summary.description:
Scalable empirical mixture models that account for across-site compositional heterogeneity.

Cluster amino acid distributions for empirical distribution mixture models.

Empirical distribution mixture models.

For your reference, please see and cite the preprint uploaded to bioRxiv.

EDCluster is a Python script obtaining empirical stationary distributions with corresponding weights from a set of site distributions. A site distribution is the probability distribution of used amino acids at a specific site in the alignment. Consequently, site distributions are are points in 20-dimensional space with elements summing up to 1.0.

Empirical distribution mixture models assume that evolution occurs along a species tree according to a mixture of amino acid substitution models.
